channel.title: Is this Legal?
channel.description:
Yes, Its another Windows XP Question. Google gave no answers.
I want to dual boot XP and some sort of Linux Disto (probably Ubuntu or Puppy Linux) on my OEM Machine. I want to format the whole HD and split the Partitions equally: 100GB/100GB. Only problem is that i would need to Re-Install my OEM copy of Windows XP. I dont want to request an OEM CD from my Manufature so I was wondering if I could use my Product Key thats on the COA of my computer on a "ordianry" setup disk. Even If that is possible would it be legal and would I get any stupid WGA popups telling me the copy is already regestered. I [b]dont[/b] want any cracks and I [b]do[/b] intend using the Internet on XP.

item.title: Is this Legal?
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

la­wl:

i have my school’s key so i can install it on infinite machines…

Lol, Thanks for that Tip. If your XP is regestered can you run WGA and change the Key to my ro your schools No Internet really sucks. (This isnt on my machine)

Read full topic

item.title: Is this Legal?
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

[quote=“Speljohan, post:4, topic:258404”][quote author=Ollie link=topic=341230.msg2641727#msg2641727 date=1232921222]
Just to expand on what Man said, read this: http://www.theeldergeek.com/hard_drives_05.htm

However if you do want to reformat, thats fine aslong as you have the CD-Key, it will automatically activate (it will look at hardware fingerprints assigned to that key and stop you from registering if they do not match), if it does not activate all you need to do is FREEPHONE microsoft (its a computer you speak to) which asks you for some digits, if that fails to activate (rarely) you will be put through to a customer service rep who will ask you “is this installed on any other copies” in which you reply to “no, my computer got BSOD and i needed to reformat”, then they will give you the activation key to activate your copy!
[/quote]It’s always fun dialing microsoft and activate the same key on 5000000 computers.[/quote]
i have my school’s key so i can install it on infinite machines…

Read full topic

item.title: Is this Legal?
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

Speljohan:

It’s always fun dialing microsoft and activate the same key on 5000000 computers.

I do that, always get redirected to some asian man who asks;
“Have you got this installed on any other machines???”
I’m always like “Ye-Nooooo”

Read full topic

item.description:

Just to expand on what Man said, read this: http://www.theeldergeek.com/hard_drives_05.htm

However if you do want to reformat, thats fine aslong as you have the CD-Key, it will automatically activate (it will look at hardware fingerprints assigned to that key and stop you from registering if they do not match), if it does not activate all you need to do is FREEPHONE microsoft (its a computer you speak to) which asks you for some digits, if that fails to activate (rarely) you will be put through to a customer service rep who will ask you “is this installed on any other copies” in which you reply to “no, my computer got BSOD and i needed to reformat”, then they will give you the activation key to activate your copy!
[/quote]It’s always fun dialing microsoft and activate the same key on 5000000 computers.[/quote]

I’ve worked in computer stores that use that trick

item.title: Is this Legal?

item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

You can just resize the NTFS partition, no need to reformat.
